CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1945, p. 3, reads: "Street Buckled - The south side of Wylie Avenue between Morgan and Wandless Streets gave a groan like a muffled explosion and buckled like this, Tuesday afternoon, residents say.  A week ago the steel striping along the curb and part of the sidewalk on the same side of the street gave a similar groan and sank.  Engineers say this portion of the Hill District still has props standing erect in empty coal-mine rooms beneath the surface, dating from the time the district was a coal mine, and was called 'Minersville.'  Severe wet spells, such as last winter and this spring brought out these props, and the ground settles, causing incidents like this. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police officer and man holding small axe standing over buckled paving blocks on Wylie Avenue between Morgan and Wandless Streets, Hill District
